page.title: 02A diary of 29 June 1985.
page.content: It was my sister's birthday and so we went to open presents in our parents' room. For our first{meal,}we had breakfast. This consisted of toast, a piece of bread placed under jets of ignited gas. On toast was spread a sticky substance called marmalade made from oranges. My{drink}was tea, whose leaves originally came from India, and milk which comes from a cow. For lunch, I ate chips, slices of potato fried at a certain temperature in fat, corned beef salad cream and garlic sausage. I read a newspaper which contained printed words and pictures of a variety of happenings before I then cycled to school. A bicycle is a simple method of{transport}consisting of a metal frame, brakes, handlebars and seat. Later I watched{television, a box which displays pictures and makes a sound.
